div.head: Capitulum 6
On the form of the baptism of John
div.p: Here it should be considered, if those baptized by John are again baptized in the baptism of Christ, and by which form of words John used.

Those who have been baptized by John, not knowing that it is the Holy Spirit, and those putting their hope in this baptism, are afterwards baptized in the baptism of Christ. Moreover the baptism of John given in the name of the one to come.

Whence
Jerome Super Ioelem :
Whoever says that he believes in Christ, and does not believe in the Holy Spirit, does not yet have clear eyes. Whence those baptized by John in the name of the one to come, that is, in the name of the Lord Jesus, because they who said
But we have not heard
that there is a Holy Spirit
Actus 19:2 , were baptized again, and indeed received baptism.
Hieronymus, Super Ioelm, c. 2 (Pl 25, 963) .

But those, who did not put their hope in the baptism of John, and were believing in the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, there were not baptized afterward, but, by the imposition of hands, performed by the Apostles over them, received the Holy Spirit. But others, who did not believe in this way, they were baptized in the baptism of Christ, as it was said.

Whence
Jerome :
Whoever was not knowing the Holy Spirit, when the received baptism from John, they were baptized again.
, lest anyone think from the Jews or from the gentiles, that water without the Holy Spirit is sufficient for salvation.

Also concerning this Ambrose:
Indeed they denied, that they knew the Holy Spirit, when they were saying that they were baptized in the baptism of John, who baptized not in his own name, but in the coming of Jesus. These ones, therefore, because they were baptized neither in the name of Christ nor with the faith of the Holy Spirit, they were not able to received the sacrament of baptism; therefore they are baptized in the name of Christ, and baptism was not repeated in these, but made new.
.
